text: Cornelia Johanna "Carola" Schouten (born October 6, 1977 in 's-Hertogenbosch) is a Dutch politician of the ChristianUnion (ChristenUnie). She has been mayor of Rotterdam since October 10, 2024. Schouten spent her youth on a farm in Giessen, a village in the Land of Heusden and Altena (a region in the very north of the Province of North Brabant). She studied business administration at Erasmus University Rotterdam, and worked afterwards at the Social Affairs Ministry and as an assistant to the ChristianUnion parliamentary group. In 2011 she was chosen into the Second Chamber. She participated in political negotiations in 2012 and in the government negotiations of 2017. From 2017 to 2022 she was minister of Agriculture, Nature and Food Quality and also third Deputy Prime Minister in the Third Rutte cabinet.The two other Deputy Prime Ministers were Hugo de Jonge (CDA) and Kajsa Ollongren (D66). From 2022 to 2024 she was minister for Poverty Policy, Participation and Pensions and also third Deputy Prime Minister in the Fourth Rutte cabinet.The two other Deputy Prime Ministers were Sigrid Kaag (D66) and Wopke Hoekstra (CDA). Carola Schouten is single with one child. She is a member of the Dutch Reformed Churches. == References == * Bio at Parlement.com == Other websites == * Bio at Government.nl Category:1977 births Category:Living people Category:Christian Union politicians Category:Deputy Prime Ministers of the Netherlands Category:Dutch Calvinists Category:Dutch civil servants Category:Government ministers of the Netherlands Category:Mayors of Rotterdam Category:Members of the House of Representatives of the Netherlands Category:People from 's-Hertogenbosch Category:Politicians from North Brabant
title: Carola Schouten
